body_html:
I have read the post you answered http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39840323/benchmark-of-howto-reading-data/39842628#39842628
you said

The solution is to increase number of Python threads,
 increase queue size to fit the entire dataset, 
start queue runners, 
and then pause main thread for a couple of seconds to give queue runners to pre-populate the queue.

so my question is :
1、 The solution is to increase number of Python threads
do you mean increase the thread number in tf.train.shuffle_batch() ? I tried it . but not working . increase the number of thread can descrease the speed.

2、 increase queue size to fit the entire dataset
increase the capacity in tf.train.shuffle_batch() ? It seems that I didn't use queue directly, so i confused that what is the queue size you mean.

3、pause main thread for a couple of seconds
this maybe work, but only a few second later it's slow again.

this maybe work, but only a few second later it's slow again.
body:
I have read the post you answered http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39840323/benchmark-of-howto-reading-data/39842628#39842628
you said 
```
The solution is to increase number of Python threads,
 increase queue size to fit the entire dataset, 
start queue runners, 
and then pause main thread for a couple of seconds to give queue runners to pre-populate the queue.
```
so my question is : 
1、 The solution is to increase number of Python threads
do you mean increase the thread number in `tf.train.shuffle_batch()` ? I tried it . but not working . increase the number of thread can descrease the speed.

2、 increase queue size to fit the entire dataset
increase the capacity in `tf.train.shuffle_batch()` ?  It seems that I didn't use queue directly, so i confused that what is the `queue size` you mean.

3、pause main thread for a couple of seconds
this maybe work, but only a few second later it's slow again.
